health_events.week_1_event: Rohan experiences a sudden onset of severe abdominal pain and is diagnosed with acute appendicitis, requiring an emergency appendectomy. He undergoes surgery and is advised to take two weeks off work for recovery.
health_events.week_2_update: Rohan is recovering from his surgery but experiences significant fatigue and discomfort. He begins to engage in light activities but is still restricted from heavy lifting and strenuous exercise. His appetite has decreased, and he is struggling to maintain his energy levels.
health_events.week_3_update: Around the third week, Rohan develops a minor issue with his digestive health; he experiences constipation as a side effect of the pain medication he was prescribed. He consults with a nutritionist to adjust his diet and incorporates more fiber-rich foods to alleviate the discomfort.
health_events.week_4_update: By week four, Rohan's abdominal pain has significantly diminished, and he is gradually returning to his normal activities. His digestive issues have improved with dietary adjustments, and he feels more energized. He resumes light exercise and begins to manage stress through tailored relaxation techniques.

test_panel.summary: At Week 0, the health assessment reveals several areas for improvement, particularly in cholesterol levels and blood pressure. The member is advised to follow a structured health plan to address these concerns.

next_steps: Investigate the cause of irregular HR readings and sync gaps
Provide options for alternative devices with better accuracy and reliability
